title: In a big reversal, Libra reportedly could peg its cryptocurrencies to national currencies
text: Facebook is willing to reverse course on its plans to tie its digital currency project to a synthetic currency tied to a basket of global currencies

title: Save Journalism Project co-founder: Mark Zuckerberg embodies the 'antithesis of free speech'
text: During a "Conversation on Free Expression" at Georgetown University on Thursday, just after Mark Zuckerberg delivered his "unfiltered take" on free speech, journalist John Stanton issued a statement from his seat in the audience. The Facebook CEO had stressed the importance of "voice and inclusion," defending the platform's impartiality.

title: Facebook open to currency-pegged stablecoins for Libra project
text: Facebook Inc , facing growing skepticism about its digital currency project Libra, on Sunday said the initiative could use cryptocurrencies based on national currencies such as the dollar, instead of the synthetic one it initially proposed.

title: Facebook isn’t free speech, it’s algorithmic amplification optimized for outrage
text: This week Mark Zuckerberg gave a speech in which he extolled “giving everyone a voice” and fighting “to uphold a wide a definition of freedom of expression as possible.” That sounds great, of course!

title: Facebook employees turn to rogue hacker from Hong Kong to learn what other teams are building
text: Jane Manchun Wong is a hacker whose passion for finding new features has made her a must-follow for Facebook employees hoping to stay up to date with their colleagues' work.

title: 'Too much power': it's Warren v Facebook in a key 2020 battle
text: The presidential hopeful and Mark Zuckerberg are facing off over big tech and its influence over our lives

title: This Week in Business: A Brexit Battering, and Mark Zuckerberg Plays Defense
text: Plus, the monthlong strike at General Motors may be over soon.

title: The Downside of Facebook's Libra May Not Be What You Think It Is
text: The Libra project's Achilles' heel may be hiding in plain sight.

title: Facebook's Brand Crisis Isn't Over Yet
text: A decline in an annual brand ranking and Zuckerberg's bizarre free-speech address show that the company still has work to do to mend its image.

title: Facebook Moves Ahead With Libra Despite Some Major Setbacks
text: The world may not be ready for Facebook's digital token Libra, but that's not stopping the social media giant from forging ahead.

title: Biden Escalates Attack on Facebook Over False Political Ads
text: Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s presidential campaign sent Facebook a letter about a false video ad that a super PAC ran on the social network.

title: News Corp to supply headlines for Facebook's upcoming news tab
text: Facebook Inc's  upcoming news tab will feature headlines from the Wall Street Journal and some other News Corp  media properties when it launches in fall of 2019, the social network said on Friday.

title: Mark Zuckerberg says Facebook's top priority is setting up FTC-mandated privacy program
text: Mark Zuckerberg said Facebook plans to implement a new privacy program that was mandated after the company's $5 billion settlement with the FTC in July.

title: Jamie Dimon says Libra will never happen
text: Jamie Dimon doesn't think Libra, Facebook's embattled cryptocurrency project, will ever get off the ground.

title: TikTok Is Just Noise for Facebook Stock
text: Few things have me worried about Facebook stock. While TikTok made some news when it literally moved into Facebook’s turf, this is mostly showmanship.

title: Jamie Dimon says Facebook's libra is 'a neat idea that'll never happen'
text: Dimon's comments come as a raft of corporate partners have dropped out of the libra crypto project.

title: $35B face data lawsuit against Facebook will proceed
text: Facebook just lost a battle in its war to stop a $35 billion class action lawsuit regarding alleged misuse of facial recognition data in Illinois. Today it was denied its request for an en banc hearing before the full slate of ninth circuit judges that could have halted the case.

title: Zuckerberg backs free speech after alleged political bias on Facebook
text: Tech analyst Shana Glenzer weighs in on Mark Zuckerberg defending free speech.

title: Facebook would be happy to accept regulation, says The Verge's Nilay Patel
text: Early Facebook investor Roger McNamee and The Verge's Nilay Patel join "Squawk Alley" to discuss Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's comments around free speech and the spread of disinformation on the social network.

title: Facebook's (FB) Watch to Get Exclusive Shows From FOX Sports
text: Facebook's (FB) Watch to receive sports-related digital shows and content from recent partnership with Fox Sports amid the intensifying sports streaming battle.

title: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg draws strong reaction to free expression speech
text: Mark Zuckerberg was at Georgetown University yesterday, defending Facebook's light moderating touch on policing its content.

title: History will not be on Facebook's side, no matter what Zuckerberg says
text: Zuckerberg's address at Georgetown University was rooted in the principles of free speech, but ignored the role Facebook plays as a publisher.

title: How the wheels came off Facebook's Libra project
text: Support for Mark Zuckerberg mission to reshape global finance is slipping away slowly but surely

title: Facebook Is No Longer a Top 10 Global Brand
text: The social networking juggernaut saw its brand value fall by 12% this year.

title: The Government Wants to Bury Facebook’s Libra Cryptocurrency
text: Zuck isn’t happy with “only” running the world’s largest and most powerful social network. He also wants to run the world’s largest currency.

title: Warren slams Zuckerberg's speech, saying Facebook's political ad policy could help Trump win again
text: The attack followed a speech the Facebook CEO gave at Georgetown University explaining his philosophy on free speech on the platform.

title: Supply-chain sources say Facebook Portal sales are ‘very low’
text: After the company’s many privacy sins, people are apparently hesitant to put a Facebook device with a camera in their living rooms. Imagine that.

title: Facebook’s double standard for political ads shows its true intentions
text: Mark Zuckerberg says Facebook’s political ad policy is in service of democracy and the public good. But this claim is undermined by its profit motive.

title: Zuckerberg changes tune on free speech, Facebook brand value declines
text: MarketWatch Tech Editor Jeremy Owens and Chatham Road Partners Director of Research Colin Gillis discuss how Mark Zuckerberg's perspectives on free speech have changed recently.

title: Standards for Facebook should be same as magazine or TV: Rep. Ro Khanna
text: Congressman Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) discusses Facebook and the growing scrutiny of Big Tech companies.

text: Mark Zuckerberg thinks Facebook is the internet.

title: 5 Top Stock Trades for Friday: MS, FB, HON, GOGO, UNP
text: Union Pacific, Facebook, Gogo, Morgan Stanley and Honeywell were our top stock trades from Thursday. Here's a look at the charts.

title: Zuckerberg defends Facebook as bastion of 'free expression' in speech
text: CEO faces quick backlash over highlighted policies, including on hate speech and voter suppression

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg defends decision to allow politicians to lie in ads
text: The social network has faced criticism for not sending political speech to fact checkers.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg defends free expression, will allow political adds without fact checking
text: Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg asserted his commitment to free speech over more aggressive policing of social-media platforms, in a rare policy speech that could have ramifications for the U.S.

title: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg on the Power of Expression
text: Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said that the social network, with its enormous size and scale, offers people a new kind of power: the ability to share their thoughts with the masses. Zuckerberg spoke to students at Georgetown University’s Gaston Hall in Washington.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg speaks on free expression at Georgetown
text: CNBC's Ylan Mui on the headlines from Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's speech at Georgetown University where he address the topic of free speech.

title: Zuckerberg: I thought about banning political ads from Facebook, but decided not to
text: "Political ads can be an important part of voice, especially for local candidates, up and coming challengers and advocacy groups that the media might not otherwise cover," Zuckerberg said.

title: Zuckerberg on Chinese censorship: Is that the internet we want?
text: China is exporting its social values, political ads are an important part of free expression, and the definition of dangerous speech must be kept in check, Facebook’s CEO Mark Zuckerberg argued today. He criticized how American companies that do business with China were becoming influenced by the country’s values.

title: Zuckerberg, Inflaming Debate, Asserts Facebook Stands for Free Expression
text: In an address at Georgetown University, the Facebook chief executive called for more free speech — not less — as his company has been assailed for allowing lies and falsehoods to appear.

title: Mark Zuckerberg giving speech on freedom of expression
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is set to deliver what he says is his most "comprehensive take" yet on freedom of expression Thursday in Washington, amid a roiling controversy over how the company handles political speech.

title: The comments on Mark Zuckerberg’s free-speech address sure look censored
text:
Almost every single one includes the words “thank you.” 
As Mark Zuckerberg gave a speech on free speech today, there was something funky happening in the comments on his Facebook Live broadcast.

title: A new bill threatens years of jail time for companies that misuse consumer data
text: A privacy-focused US senator is introducing sweeping legislation on Thursday that imposes sharp penalties on companies and executives who fail to protect consumer data, bringing additional pressure to bear on the tech industry.

title: Facebook loses spot in top-ten on list of most valuable brands
text: This top list of valuable brands includes Apple, Google and Amazon, but not Facebook.

title: Kohl's will partner with Facebook in 2020
text: Kohl's Corp. KSS, -0.84% said Thursday that it will partner with Facebook Inc. FB, +0.35% in 2020 to select and engage with brands that will be included in its recently launched platform, Curated by Kohl's, and its platform for emerging beauty and skincare brands, The Beauty Checkout.

title: Even If Libra Is a Disaster, Facebook Stock Will Keep on Growing
text: As I noted about three months ago when I last visited Facebook stock in this space, the company, by its own doing, is viewed by some as arrogant if not somewhat reckless, prone to public relations gaffes and lacks for trust among the public. The latter issue is one of the sticking points when it comes to Libra.

title: Investment strategist doubts Facebook's Libra will be a real payments disruptor
text: Richard Harris, chief executive of Port Shelter Investment Management, says there are plenty of innovations in the payments sector already.

title: Facebook Is Losing Employees to One of Its Most Viable Emerging Competitors
text: The social networking giant can't buy its rival this time.
